channel.title: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?
channel.description:
I used to use this like everyday, but I forget the code now and i dont have it anywhere on my computer since I formatted not too long ago.
I have a big folder with over 300 3D models, and like 600-1000 textures. Of those 300 models, I have 4 file extensions: .3ds, .b3d, and .x, and .max. The only one I need is the .b3d so I need to make a command to delete all .x, ,3ds, and .max files. Each model has it's OWN folder, so I cant just easily get rid of them, it would take hours. So, can someone tell me the command to delete all .3ds, .x, and .max files in the entire directory?
Thanks

item.title: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:6, topic:3083”]del /s /q *.x
del /s /q *.3ds
del /s /q *.max

;D[/quote]
Yes, that was it, Thanks!!

Read full topic
item.source: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?

item.title: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I searched google, but it is far too broad and I couldnt find what I am looking for. I can’t believe i forgot it, I used to use it all the time. It’s on the tip of my tongue, but I wont remember it until I see it.

Read full topic
item.source: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?

item.title: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yeah deltree is for deleting a folder and it’s subfolders.

I’ll try looking for a include subfolders option.

Read full topic
item.source: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?

item.title: Batch file command for deleting certain filetypes?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:2, topic:3083”]Don’t know if this will work, dunno all the commands for DOS, but with this was I think you’d have to have one in each folder.

del *.x
del *.3ds
del *.max[/quote]

The one i used was different, but I’ll try that. And if it doesnt delete all of them in each folder, then I’ll try deltree instead.

Thanks
edit*
Hmm… That works, but it has to be in each folder, which kind of defeats the purpose of what Im trying to do. Deltree didnt work either.

Read full topic
